The species is known for its nesting behavior, as it constructs its nests in dense aggregations in areas with alkaline soils, often near agricultural fields.

Alkali bees play a crucial role in the pollination of various crops, particularly alfalfa, a important forage crop for livestock. Their nesting behavior and specific habitat requirements make them an important target for conservation efforts in regions where they are found.

The species is known to be an efficient pollinator, with its foraging behavior and floral preferences contributing to the maintenance of diverse plant communities. Ongoing research aims to better understand the ecology and life history of the Alkali bee to support its conservation and management in agricultural landscapes.
